intro: Licaria cubensis, commonly known as the Cuban licaria, is a flowering plant native to the Caribbean, particularly Cuba. It belongs to the Malvaceae family, which includes hibiscus and cotton. The plant features showy, pentagonal flowers that are typically pink or purple in color. Its leaves are alternate, ovate, and have a soft, velvety texture. Licaria cubensis is often found in moist, shaded environments such as forests and along stream banks.
